case_title: MUHAMMAD SIDDIQUE KHAN vs AZAD JAMMU AND KASHMIR GOVERNMENT Through Secretary Revenue, Azad Jammu And Kashmir, Muzaffarabad
court_name: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Service Tribunal
respondent: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Government Through Secretary Revenue, Azad Jammu And Kashmir, Muzaffarabad

key_issues.review_petition_timing: Review petition was filed beyond the allowed time.
key_issues.final_order_challenge: Appeal was not filed against the final order dated 22-7-1981.
key_issues.public_interest: Retirement order was deemed to be in the public interest.

legal_references.case: Fida Muhammad Rathore v. Azad Jammu and Kashmir
Mir Muhammad Sharif v. Azad Jammu and Kashmir Government

appellant.promotion_efficiency: Promotion to Office Superintendent indicates efficiency and fitness for service.
appellant.lack_of_adverse_remarks: Annual confidential reports were not conveyed, showing no adverse remarks.
appellant.procedural_flaws: Retirement order was passed without giving the appellant an opportunity to present his case.

respondent.review_timing: Review application was filed beyond the allowed time.
respondent.promotion_basis: Promotion was based on seniority and did not negate the retirement order.
respondent.public_interest: Retirement was made in the public interest as determined by the review committee.

tribunal_findings.review_petition: Filed beyond the allowed time and was rightly rejected.
tribunal_findings.final_order: Appeal was not filed against the final order dated 22-7-1981, making the appeal incompetent.
tribunal_findings.public_interest: Retirement was made in the public interest and was justified based on the review committee's recommendations.

legal_analysis.civil_servants_act: Section 12 of the Civil Servants Act grants the Government authority to retire civil servants in the public interest.
legal_analysis.sharia_compliance: Section 31(5) of the Interim Constitution Act, 1974 does not void laws against Sharia but requires their conformity over time.

conclusion.reasoning: Appeal was incompetent due to technical defects and lacked merit.
